Detailed Description

The abstract Picture object that represents a picture taken from a robot.

Author:
Richard Edwards, John Hoare

Definition at line 64 of file Picture.h.

Member Function Documentation

virtual PicturePtr Picture::clone (  )  [virtual]

Get a "clone" of this picture.

A clone is also a copy. If you'd like another copy of this picture use this function.

Example: Picture* pic = robot.takePicture("color"); Picture* pic2 = pic->clone();

From this you'll have two "copies" of the same picture, so you're free to change around "pic" without worry of changing "pic2"

Returns:
A clone of this picture
virtual Pixel Picture::getPixel ( int  x,
int  y 
) [virtual]
Returns:
A pixel struct representing the pixel at x,y
virtual bool Picture::loadPicture ( const char *  filename  )  [virtual]

Load an image from a filename, for now, only jpeg files are supported.

Parameters:
filename The file to read from.
Returns:
True if load sucessful, false if fails (for wrong colorspace, etc.)
virtual void Picture::savePicture ( const char *  filename  )  [virtual]

Save an image to a file, only jpeg files are supported.

A .jpg will be appended to the given filename.

Parameters:
filename The name of the file you save (without the .jpg file extention)
virtual void Picture::show (  )  [virtual]

Display the picture on the screen.

This function will block (wait) until the user has closed the window, before the program continues running.

virtual void Picture::show ( std::string  windowname  )  [virtual]

Display the picture on the screen.

This function will immediately return, and will not wait for the user to close the window.

Parameters:
windowname The name of the window to show the image in. If the named window does not already exist, then it will create a new window, if it already exists, it will draw the image into that window.
